009package imagingbook.common.filter.linear;
010
011import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
012
013/**
014 * This class represents a 2D filter kernel.
015 * 
016 * @author WB
017 * @version 2020/12/29
018 */
019public class Kernel2D {
020        
021        private final float[][] H;      // H[y][x] !!
022        private final int xc, yc;
023        private final int width, height;
024
025        /**
026         * Constructor. Assumes that the kernel's structure is H[y][x] (i.e., vertical coordinate first) and the hot spot is
027         * at its center. The kernel is normalized by default.
028         *
029         * @param H the 2D kernel array
030         */
031        public Kernel2D(float[][] H) {
032                this(H, (H[0].length - 1) / 2, (H.length - 1) / 2, true);
033        }
034
035        /**
036         * Full constructor. Assumes that the kernel's structure is H[y][x] (i.e., vertical coordinate first), the hot spot
037         * position must be specified. The kernel is optionally normalized.
038         *
039         * @param H the 2D kernel array
040         * @param xc the x-coordinate of the kernel's hot spot, default is (width-1)/2
041         * @param yc the y-coordinate of the kernel's hot spot, default is (height-1)/2
042         * @param normalize if true the kernel is normalized (to sum = 1)
043         */
044        public Kernel2D(float[][] H, int xc, int yc, boolean normalize) {
045                this.H = (normalize) ? normalize(H) : Matrix.duplicate(H);
046                this.width = H[0].length;
047                this.height = H.length;
048                this.xc = xc;
049                this.yc = yc;
050                validate();
051        }
052        
053        /**
054         * Creates the effective 2D kernel from two 1D kernels.
055         * 
056         * @param Hx the 1D kernel for the x-direction
057         * @param Hy the 1D kernel for the y-direction
058         * @param normalize if true the kernel is normalized (to sum = 1)
059         */
060        public Kernel2D(Kernel1D Hx, Kernel1D Hy, boolean normalize) {
061                this(getEffectiveKernel(Hx, Hy), Hx.getXc(), Hy.getXc(), normalize);
062        }
063
064        /**
065         * Calculates the effective 2D kernel array from two 1D kernels assumed to be applied in x- and y-direction,
066         * respectively. The result is not normalized. Use the constructor {@link #Kernel2D(Kernel1D, Kernel1D, boolean)} to
067         * create the equivalent (optionally normalized) 2D kernel. Note that the kernel coordinates are {@code H[y][x]}.
068         *
069         * @param Hx the 1D kernel for the x-direction
070         * @param Hy the 1D kernel for the y-direction
071         * @return the effective 2D kernel matrix
072         */
073        public static float[][] getEffectiveKernel(Kernel1D Hx, Kernel1D Hy) {
074                float[] kernelX = Hx.getH();
075                float[] kernelY = Hy.getH();
076                
077                float[][] kernel = new float[kernelX.length][kernelY.length];
078                for (int y = 0; y < kernelY.length; y++) {
079                        for (int x = 0; x < kernelX.length; x++) {
080                                kernel[y][x] = kernelX[x] * kernelY[y];
081                        }
082                }
083                return kernel;
084        }
085        
086        private void validate() {
087                if (xc < 0 || yc < 0 || xc >= width || yc >= height) {
088                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("xc/yc is outside the filter kernel");
089                }
090                if (!Matrix.isRectangular(H)) {
091                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("filter kernel is not rectangular");
092                }
093        }
094
095        /**
096         * Returns the kernel's 2D array. Note that the kernel coordinates are {@code H[y][x]}.
097         *
098         * @return the kernel's 2D array
099         */
100        public float[][] getH() {
101                return H;
102        }
103        
104        /**
105         * Returns the width of this kernel.
106         * @return the kernel's width
107         */
108        public int getWidth() {
109                return width;
110        }
111        
112        /**
113         * Returns the height of this kernel.
114         * @return the kernel's height
115         */
116        public int getHeight() {
117                return height;
118        }
119        
120        /**
121         * Returns the horizontal center coordinate of this kernel.
122         * @return the kernel's x-center coordinate
123         */
124        public int getXc() {
125                return xc;
126        }
127        
128        /**
129         * Returns the vertical center coordinate of this kernel.
130         * @return the kernel's y-center coordinate
131         */
132        public int getYc() {
133                return yc;
134        }
135        
136        // ----------------------------------------------------------
137
138        /**
139         * Normalizes the specified array such that its sum becomes 1. Throws an exception if the array's sum is zero. The
140         * original array is not modified.
141         *
142         * @param A a 2D array
143         * @return the normalized array
144         * @throws ArithmeticException if the array sums to zero
145         */
146        public static float[][] normalize(float[][] A) throws ArithmeticException {
147                float s = (float) (1.0 / Matrix.sum(A));
148                if (!Double.isFinite(s))
149                        throw new ArithmeticException("zero kernel sum, cannot normalize");
150                return Matrix.multiply(s, A);
151        }
152
153}
